meanings.definition: An excuse for not doing something
meanings.sent1: She always had a copout ready when asked to do chores.
meanings.sent2: Using a copout to skip homework is not a good habit.
meanings.sent3: His copout about the dog eating his homework made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The copout of 'I forgot' was wearing thin with the teacher.
meanings.sent5: Coming up with a copout is not the same as facing the consequences.

meanings.sent1: He tends to copout when it's time to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: Don't copout on your promises; be reliable.
meanings.sent3: She tried to copout of the group presentation but was caught.
meanings.sent4: Avoiding the truth is just another way to copout.
meanings.sent5: Choosing to copout only leads to more trouble in the end.
